New Records: Germany became the first team in European Championship history to have two players aged 21 or under (Jamal Musiala and Florian Wirtz) score in the same game
Key Match Events: Germany dominated the first half with a 3-0 lead after 45 minutes, Ryan Porteous received a red card for a horror tackle, and Antonio Rudiger scored an own goal
Pre-Game Insights: Scotland struggled defensively with a 5-4-1 formation, missing key players like Billy Gilmour and Lawrence Shankland, and faced challenges in possession and transition
Post-Match Reflections: Julian Nagelsmann praised Germany's team effort and highlighted Toni Kroos's importance, while Steve Clarke expressed disappointment but focused on future games
Miscellaneous Highlights: Referee Clement Turpin enforced new UEFA officiating guidelines, Maximilian Mittelstadt demonstrated growth despite a challenging start, and Scotland scored a consolation goal
